Content: Can a timer be pushed off on the client, then RPC to server to spawn shit?  Having an issue where when more than one player is doing the same interaction, the timer just stops for everyone once the 1st player completes the interaction, the rest just stop and bug out.

Author: da0ne_
Content: Timers and actions, depends on what your "timer" implementation is. And if you speak of Actions as in `ActionContinuousBase` there's better already implemented timed actions

Author: osodirty
Content: It's a timer looking at variables. The action moves a container from a "rest area" to a table. Once 1st player moves their crate back to the rest zone, it fucks everyone else's up by stopping the timer that apparently gets shared to all of the containers (or players) tried both ways.

Author: osodirty
Content: Trying to avoid only having one place on the entire server that the containers can be accessed from.

Author: osodirty
Content:
Get Crate action looks to see if you have a crate, if so, move it to your position, if not, create one, give it your persistentId, then move it to you, and set a timer.
Timer waits for you to, die, log out, walk away, or use the action "Save Crate" which just sets a bool to false on the player, then moves the crate, resets the countdown, and shuts off the timer.
